text: So I'm relying quite heavily on the active inference framework for my definition of cognition and the way the Cognar system would work.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: But active inference is essentially a Bayesian description of cognition.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: It's a normative principle underwriting cognition in biological and artificial agents.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: In active inference, there's an intelligent agent and a world that the intelligent agent is acting in.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: Maybe there's even multiple intelligent agents acting in the world.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: An agent has an internal generative model about how the world works.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: That is, given some conditions,
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: It sees that there's potential actions that could be taken and it sees that there's likely outcomes of various actions.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So an agent has a model of how the world works.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: What will happen if I do A?
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: What will happen if I do B?
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: What will happen if I don't run from that lion?
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And the agent and its world are separated, in a sense, statistically separated by what's called a Markov blanket.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And that blanket consists of agent actions and agent observations.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So as an agent, I take some action.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: That action affects the world.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: The world reacts in some way according to the world's generative process.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And then things change, conditions change.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And as an agent, I perceive my world, but maybe it's dark and I don't perceive it very closely, or maybe it's loud and I don't hear it very accurately, or I get sensations from the world, but I'm not necessarily observing the actual state of the world.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: I'm observing some kind of noisy representation of that.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So the Markov blanket, it's conditionally separates the world from the agent.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And Active Inference is the framework that I'm using to talk about cognition and not just cognition, how it works, but also what is the purpose of cognition?
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: What is functional cognition versus dysfunctional cognition?

text: Next slide, please.
